intro: Arabis pedicellata, commonly known as the rock白菜 or rock mustard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many familiar garden plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, alpine environments. It features basal leaves that are lobed or divided, and its flowers are small, white, and clustered in racemes. Arabis pedicellata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
